creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: nude Adam in contrapposto stance next to tree, holding a fruit still attached to the tree; a lion rests behind Adam on the ground
inscription:
Signature, Stamp

in graphite on verso: B11I | 8008 | indecipherable marks
markings: brown stamps on verso, UL and UR, respectively: Kupferstich-Kabinett, Staatliche Kunstsammlungen, Dresden, Lugt 1616 and 1618, for duplicate); black collector\'s stamp on recto, LR, unidentified
provenance: Collector with unidentified mark (not in Lugt). Kupferstich-Kabinett, Staatliche Kunstsammlungen duplicate, Lugt 1616 and 1618, Dresden. John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram in plate, along right edge: [AG]
title: Adam
